words.explanation: Your horrendous grammar affects the quality of your input as an interlocutor.
Your grammar’s effects are so unspeakable that you should be prosecuted at The Hague.

hint.text: Effect is most commonly a noun; affect is most commonly a verb.

words.explanation: By using improper grammar, you are laying bare your ignorance.
I cannot bear this any longer: please, learn your damn homophones.
Capital punishment should be applied to people who use improper grammar.
Improper grammar is not allowed inside the capitol.

hint.text: Capitol has an ‘O,’ which is round like the rotunda in the US Capitol Building.

words.explanation: Proper homophone usage is a necessary complement to a well-rounded individual.
If you can’t get your homophones correct, no one will compliment you.
If you can’t discern the difference between homophones, then be discreet.
There is a discrete difference between someone who knows homophones and someone who does not.
The dual benefit of knowing homophones is that you will be able to communicate effectively and you won’t look like a jackass.
If you can’t even get homophones right, imagine how you’d do in a duel. Let’s just put it this way: John Wayne knew his homophones.

hint.text: Duel is usually deadly; dual is almost never harmful at all.

words.explanation: To be fair, I expected you to know this.
How did you fare on the test?

hint.text: She was fair enough to pay the fare.

words.explanation: Bad grammar shall no longer rear its ugly head.
It’s a terrible thing to use improper grammar.

hint.text: Its can only be possessive; It’s is a contraction of ‘it’ & ‘is’. Strongbad can explain this in further detail.

words.explanation: The grammar gods shall let loose some horrible plague upon you should you choose to continue fucking up homophones.
Using bad grammar is a social stigma, which makes you lose credibility.
He was her permier source of gossip.
Being the star of the movie, she was expected to attend the  <em>premiere.

hint.text: A premiere is an event where a new concert or movie is shown for the first time. The adjective premier means best or foremost.

words.explanation: The principal frowns upon fucking up homophones.
Using proper grammar is a good principle to live by.

hint.text: Principal contains the word ‘pal,’ which is a person just like the principal.

words.explanation: By fucking up homophones, you show that most fourth graders have better grammar than you.
If you can’t write properly, then don’t write at all.
Their egregious grammar sin of mixing up homophones will not go unpunished.
There is no excuse for fucking this up.
They’re just stupid if they can’t get this.
I’m going to ban you from speaking if you can’t get homophones right.
The rest of the world hates you, too.
You should have learned these when you were two.
The verses of the canonized Holy Text do not contain incorrect homophone usage; therefore, it is a cardinal sin to fuck them up.
A match against good grammar versus bad grammar is like Batman fighting a baby and stealing his candy in the process.

hint.text: Versus can only be a preposition, so it can only take the form of ‘Me versus You’ or ‘This versus That’; verses will almost always be a noun.

words.explanation: Your grammar sucks.
You’re an idiot if you fuck up homophones.

hint.text: Your can only be possessive; you’re is a contraction of ‘you’ & ‘are’. See theWarehouse for further explication.
